answers.answer: I think it's a sign of preeclampsia so they would probobly see if you had it or not and if you do you probobly would be induced
And if I don't have it do I have to wait on due date I feel terrible. I don't think I have any swelling though
Yep! I'm being induced in the morning for it. Definitely a sign of pre eclampsia. I'm 37 weeks today.  I started with just headaches and blurred vision 4 weeks ago, and it just got worse.
But if I test negative will they still induce?

If there is no protein in the urine or if your blood pressure isn't high most likely they will not induce. You have to have sure signs for them to. If your blood pressure is slightly elevated they may try bed rest before they induce that's what my Dr did with me my first pregnancy good luck
with my first I literally went blind in one eye for several hours. no signs of preeclampsia, so they monitored me until my vision came back and sent me home.

With both my oldest kids I had pre eclampsia my vision wasn't blurred. I had white spots and squiggly lines in my vision and I lost my perfreal (spelling) vision had bad swelling in my legs that when I would push on them they would indent and not come back up for several minutes and the headache was like a 9-10 they out me on bed rest but I was also only 34 weeks where you are technically full term I would get ahold of your doc and go over your symptoms with them they may want you to go to the ER and if it is high blood pressure they will probably just deliver considering you are so close any how good luck hope my experience helps and makes since
I for got about the protein levels they will probably want you to do a 24 hr urinalisys  unless your first results are extremely high
I for got about the protein levels they will probably want you to do a 24 hr urinalisys  unless your first results are extremely high the first time around
